strings:
<se_low>King Trode: Dear Medea.
It's all thanks to you that we were able to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Princess Medea: Neeeeigh!
<se_low>King Trode: Now we can sail west across this huge ocean. Our retainers will defeat Dhoulmagus and our curse will be lifted.
<se_low>King Trode: Try to be strong for just a while longer, my brave Princess.
<se_low>King Trode: To the west lies a continent of enormous proportions and it contains many towns.
<se_low>King Trode: One of them has a close relationship with my own Trodain...

<se_low>King Trode: But now's not the time to be thinking about that.
First we must go after Dhoulmagus!

<se_high>Jessica: It feels like a dream!
Did the harp really bring back memories of an ancient ocean!?

<se_high>Jessica: It's kind of hard to believe.
But we're here now and we have our own ship at last!
<se_high>Jessica: Now we can finally catch up with Dhoulmagus.
<se_low>Yangus: Guv! Did ya know about 'ow the sky goes red in the west? Somefin' to do wiv dusk...or was it dawn?

<se_low>Yangus: Hang on a minute...
Which way round do they go!?
I've clean forgot!
<se_def>Angelo: Now we've got ourselves a boat, why don't we take a bit of a detour? We've only seen half of the world. There's still so much left to enjoy!
<se_def>Angelo: All we know is that Dhoulmagus headed west, right?<page>Angelo: But the western continent is huge, so we're going to need more information if we want to track him down.
<se_low>King Trode: Listen to me, <hero>.
<se_low>King Trode: We know Dhoulmagus murdered someone in Baccarat, but we've gleaned nothing of his movements after that.
<se_low>King Trode: I think it would be wise to return to Baccarat and see if we can't gather some more information before setting off again.

<se_low>King Trode: Off we go! Set a course northwest of Baccarat!
We'll catch up with Dhoulmagus at that island if it's the last thing we do!
<se_low>Yangus: It sounded like that barman who we 'eard whisperin' stuff in the 'otel might o' known somefin' about Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: We should find out wot 'e knows.
Even if we 'ave to squeeze 'im a bit.
Heh heh! I'll take care o' that side o' things!
<se_low>Yangus: So Dhoulmagus 'as gone to an island in the northwest, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: Once we've figured out where 'e is, all we gotta do is take care o' the blighter, eh?
Break a few legs, like!

<se_high>Jessica: Okay, so we know Dhoulmagus came to Baccarat.
But where did he go after that?
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to imagine Dhoulmagus actually running away from the posse that was sent after him.<page>Jessica: I mean, he was strong enough to kill Alistair, wasn't he?
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe the posse who set out to avenge Golding's murder have already disposed of Dhoulmagus?

<se_low>Yangus: Eh!? You wot!?
Ya reckon Dhoulmagus is that much of an easy mark?

<se_def>Angelo: Yes, I can just picture it.
Dhoulmagus's corpse drifting around in the ocean like a limp jellyfish.
<se_low>King Trode: Stop talking poppycock, and start thinking about where Dhoulmagus might be!
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder what Golding's son and daughter are like? They must hate Dhoulmagus for having killed their father.
<se_def>Angelo: At least they'll have each other. If they get on, that is. If they don't, it's going to be very hard for them.
<se_def>Angelo: There could be all manner of traps waiting for us where Dhoulmagus has gone.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot, like a welcomin' committee o' monsters or somefin'?
Heh heh heh! Just let me at 'em!

<se_high>Jessica: More like a surprise party, I think.
Maybe they'll even have a cake!

<se_def>Angelo: I'm serious!
Don't joke about it, think about it!
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder what Golding's son and daughter are like? They must hate Dhoulmagus for having killed their father.
<se_def>Angelo: At least they'll have each other. If they get on, that is. If they don't, it's going to be very hard for them.
<se_low>King Trode: Argonia and Trodain are on friendly terms, as you know. It's the Prince of Argonia who Medea is betrothed to.

<se_low>King Trode: If I didn't look so...figuratively challenged, I would ask the King for the mirror myself.<page>King Trode: Sadly, however, everything is more than a little challenging at the moment!
<se_low>King Trode: Should the King of Argonia or any of his vassals see the Princess and I in our current state, the engagement would be broken off in a trice!
<se_low>King Trode: So I must ask that you keep our identities a secret. I'm sorry, I cannot be of any further assistance with the mirror.
<se_low>Yangus: I know it's a bit late to be worryin' about it now...<page>Yangus: ...but are Grandad an' the 'orse-princess really gonna go back to normal if we put Dhoulmagus out the picture?
<se_def>Angelo: Hm. Interesting. Yes, I'm not sure that I'm willing to believe they really are the King and Princess of Trodain until I see it for myself.
<se_high>Jessica: Yeah! Sometimes I wonder if maybe King Trode and <hero> aren't really from Trodain, and we're just wrapped up in a crazy delusion of theirs!

<se_low>King Trode: Desist with this drivel at once!
We must get going to Argonia!
<se_low>Yangus: Even if we go to Argonia, d'ya think we've got any chance o' gettin' the King to lend us that magic mirror?
<se_high>Jessica: We need the magic mirror to get inside the Dark Ruins.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's go to Argonia and see if they'll lend it to us. They might not say yes, but what do we have to lose?

<se_def>Angelo: So what are we going to do now?
Looks like our journey might have run its course, wouldn't you say?
<se_def>Angelo: I mean, you can't get more tight-fisted and greedy than a royal.

<se_def>Angelo: There's no way someone like that is going to lend us a family treasure.
Our only hope is to try and steal it.
<se_low>King Trode: We must hurry to the royal hunting ground.
<se_low>King Trode: If we fail to see the Prince through this initiation ceremony, we won't be able to acquire the vital magic mirror.
<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus could slip out of the Dark Ruins at any moment!
<se_high>Jessica: We simply have to get the magic mirror before that happens. We need to complete the King's errand as quickly as possible!

<se_def>Angelo: What are you doing? The royal hunting ground's to the east of Argonia.
Or do we have something to attend to here?

<se_def>Angelo: That's all right then.
But just remember, we can't afford to waste too much time.

<se_def>Angelo: What!?
Then let's leave now and get over to the royal hunting ground!
<se_def>Prince Charmles: A question, Yangus!

<se_low>Yangus: Er...yeah?
Wot is it?
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Why do you all call your driver King Trode? Surely that ‘thing’ isn't the king of anywhere!

<se_low>Yangus: Well, er... Ya see... It's, er...
Nah, you've got it wrong, Charmles.

<se_low>Yangus: Grandad's name ain't KING nuffin'.
It's Kin Gtrode, see.
Funny name, I know.<page>Yangus: But 'e ain't from anywhere 'round 'ere, see.
Ya can prob'ly tell that from the way 'e looks though, eh?
<se_low>King Trode: Oh, dear Goddess!
<se_def>Prince Charmles: It has been some time since I've set foot outside of the castle, and I can't say I'm enjoying it one bit!
<se_def>Prince Charmles: If only I didn't have to bother with this piffling initiation, I should head straight for Baccarat and the casino!

<se_def>Angelo: I'm afraid the casino's closed, my friend.
The owner's been killed.

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Ah-what!? No more gambling!?
But it's the only pleasure I know!
<se_low>Yangus: It'll be worth it if we do get the mirror like wot was agreed.

<se_low>Yangus: I just 'ope they don't change their mind at the last minute an' go back on it or nuffin'.
It is a royal treasure, after all.

<se_high>Jessica: Prince Charmles, I've been meaning to ask.
Did you ever have a problem with your future wife being decided for you at such a young age?
<se_def>Prince Charmles: When I was growing up I did wonder about that, but I'm rather thankful for it now.

<se_def>Prince Charmles: I shall marry a beautiful and renowned princess without so much as lifting a finger.
What could be better!?

<se_def>Angelo: But you've never even met her, have you?
What would you do if she turned out to be as ugly as a mule?

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Shut up! How dare you insult my fiancée!?
What would a mere commoner like you know of beauty!? You will apologise at once!

<se_high>Jessica: You could probably make quite a nice ring out of an Argon heart.
...Or would that be a bit of a waste?
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Well, aren't you sharp? Yes, when the initiation ceremony is over, the Argon heart will be fashioned into a wedding ring for my bride.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Part of the purpose of the initiation is to acquire a stone to bequeath to one's future spouse.

<se_def>Angelo: So. Back to Argonia, right?
And then we can bid adieu to the Prince.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hmph! You're fortunate that I'm in such a good mood. Normally I wouldn't let such base sarcasm go unpunished!

<se_def>Prince Charmles: With the initiation out of the way, there's nothing more for me to do but sit back and wait for the big day!<page>Prince Charmles: And then the big night!
Aha ha ha!

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Though I've never seen her myself, I hear Princess Medea is an unparalleled beauty.
I wonder if she can cook.

<se_low>King Trode: Splendid, splendid!
We've acquired the magic mirror as planned!
<se_low>King Trode: We've had to go to such lengths, everything's spinning in my head like a kaleidoscope.
<se_low>King Trode: It certainly hasn't been easy, but at least we have the magic mirror now, as promised.
<se_low>King Trode: We've had to go to such lengths, everything's spinning in my head like a kaleidoscope.

<se_low>Yangus: Right, Dhoulmagus!
You're about to get wot's comin' to ya!
<se_low>Yangus: Huuurgh! Huuurgh! Huuurgh!
<se_low>Yangus: Since we 'ad a bit of a break from chasin' 'im, I weren't feelin' so much anger an' that towards Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: So I just needed to charge meself up a bit.
Y'know, get the ol' blood pumpin' again.

<se_high>Jessica: We have the magic mirror.
That means we're one step closer to Dhoulmagus.

<se_high>Jessica: Still, it doesn't feel that way.
I just won't be able to relax until we find him.

<se_high>Jessica: Wait! Remember the scholar at the castle?
He must have been talking about that old man!

<se_high>Jessica: You know!
The one from the mystical spring!
<se_def>Angelo: Now that we've parted company with Prince Charmless...<page>Angelo: ...perhaps I dare venture to ask the father of the bride what he thinks about his future son-in-law?

<se_low>King Trode: Hmph!
It's none of your business!
And well you should know it!

<se_high>Jessica: There's no need to ask King Trode what he thinks.
The scowl on his face speaks volumes.

<se_low>Yangus: I dunno. I can't read 'im meself.
Grandad always looks sour.
Ya never know wot 'e's thinkin'.

<se_low>King Trode: Stop pooh-poohing me, and get a move on!
Have you forgotten we're in the middle of a very important voyage!?

<se_def>Angelo: What do we do now?
Are we going straight to the Dark Ruins to try and break down the aura with the magic mirror?

<se_def>Angelo: All right.
If that's what you've decided, I suppose we'd better get going.
<se_def>Angelo: But I can't help worrying about what that scholar said back in Argonia.
<se_def>Angelo: So you're worried about what that scholar told us, too? About there being no magic left in the mirror, I mean.
<se_def>Angelo: Me too. I get the impression the mirror isn't going to break through the dark aura like we hoped. Nothing's ever that simple.
<se_low>King Trode: Well at least the mirror we procured from Argonia wasn't a cheap imitation!
<se_low>King Trode: But it seems the process of turning it back into the sun mirror is going to be very bothersome indeed.
<se_low>Yangus: So we done all that to get our 'ands on a mirror that don't do nuffin' but let me see 'ow cheesed-off I look!?<page>Yangus: It's just a bloomin' dud!?
<se_def>Angelo: If only there were two magic mirrors in Argonia, we could take our one back and exchange it for a working model.

<se_high>Jessica: If you ask me, I think we've been cheated!
What if there really are two mirrors, and they gave us the broken one on purpose?
<se_high>Jessica: We should go back and demand a refund!
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't too good at rememb'rin' stuff, but I thought that old geezer said we was lookin' for a place over the sea, didn't 'e?
<se_low>Yangus: An arch o' rock goin' over the water or somefin'.
<se_high>Jessica: We're so close to getting inside the Dark Ruins!
<se_high>Jessica: I can hardly wait to get my hands on Dhoulmagus!
<se_def>Angelo: Use the mirror to deflect the spell of a sea monster, and it'll absorb the spell's magical energy. That was what he said, wasn't it?
<se_def>Angelo: But there's more than one fish in the sea, as they say. Which monster's spell are we looking for exactly?
<se_low>King Trode: Once we've dispelled the dark aura, all that remains is to defeat Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>King Trode: The end of this torturous journey is finally in sight!

<se_low>Yangus: I'm pretty excited about this sun mirror.
Wot d'ya think's gonna 'appen when we use it to get rid o' the dark aura?

<se_low>Yangus: It's been 'ard enough to get 'old o' the thing.
I'll be well disappointed if it don't go through it like Munchie though a block o' cheese!
<se_high>Jessica: So what are we going to do if this sun mirror doesn't work as promised?
<se_def>Angelo: Then we just hang around at the entrance to the Dark Ruins and wait for Dhoulmagus to come out. He's got to surface at some point.

<se_low>Yangus: Why the 'ell didn't ya think o' that before, ya lemon!?
That woulda been loads easier!

<se_low>King Trode: You haven't a brain between you!
The longer we procrastinate, the more suffering the people of Trodain will be forced to endure!
<se_low>King Trode: Whatever minor hardships YOU have to suffer in comparison, our mission remains the same: defeat Dhoulmagus! And as quickly as possible!
<se_high>Jessica: I'm not going to be able to relax until we've broken through that dark aura.
<se_high>Jessica: To be honest, I still have my doubts about the sun mirror being able to do the job.
<se_def>Angelo: Now that we've breathed life back into the sun mirror, we're ready to break through the aura at the Dark Ruins, aren't we?

<se_def>Angelo: So come on, <hero>!
Let's storm the place!

<se_low>King Trode: Into the Dark Ruins we go! Well, you go!
Now that we've dispelled the dark aura, the time of Dhoulmagus's demise is nigh!

<se_low>Yangus: I ain't like the rest o' you.
I ain't got nuffin' personal against Dhoulmagus.
<se_low>Yangus: I feel a bit out of it, really, not sharin' all the 'atred wiv ya!
<se_high>Jessica: The long journey to avenge my brother's death will be over soon.
<se_high>Jessica: But will it end in Dhoulmagus's demise, or our own?
<se_high>Jessica: King Trode once told me that you were a royal guardsman at his castle.
<se_def>Angelo: You must've been rubbing shoulders with the warrior elite, <hero>. There's a lot more to you than meets the eye, my friend.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot d'ya mean, ‘more than meets the eye’!?
Guv's a top fighter.
You can't lump 'im in wiv the small fry.
<se_low>Yangus: Mind you, guardsman sounds pretty grand, but it must've been spoilt a bit, bein' one o' Grandad's men.
<se_low>King Trode: Hm? What did you say!?
<se_def>Angelo: We don't know why Dhoulmagus decided to shut himself away in the Dark Ruins, and we don't know what he's doing in there.
<se_def>Angelo: But we shouldn't allow him too much time to settle in. We don't want him getting comfortable.
<se_low>King Trode: We must track down Jessica at once!
<se_low>King Trode: I'd completely forgotten she was in possession of my precious sceptre.
<se_low>King Trode: I shall be too ashamed to face my ancestors ‘up there’ without it!

<se_low>Yangus: Wot are you talkin' about, Grandad!?
That old stick belongs in a museum. It ain't that we've gotta worry about, it's Jessica.
<se_low>King Trode: Just when I was about to call a meeting to discuss how we should proceed, Jessica disappears!

<se_low>King Trode: As if the curse's stubborn persistence wasn't enough of a blow, we're now a man down as well!<page>King Trode: And one of my most attractive men at that!
Fresh salt in a poor king's wounds!
<se_low>Yangus: If Jessica's just got fed up wiv us an' decided to make a clean break of it, I ain't gonna try an' change 'er mind.
<se_low>Yangus: But if she's in some sort o' bother, I'll do wotever I can to 'elp 'er.

<se_def>Angelo: That was short-lived...
I was hoping to bask in the drunken delight of victory a little longer.

<se_def>Angelo: The perfect excuse for a bit of debauchery, ruined thanks to Jessica.
And I was hoping to enjoy it with her!
<se_low>Yangus: I can see why it's called the sun mirror.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a load shinier now we've put the magic back in.
<se_high>Jessica: Now that we've managed to recharge the mirror, we can punch through that aura in the Dark Ruins!
<se_high>Jessica: And once that happens, there won't be anything stopping us from making Dhoulmagus pay for what he did to my brother!

<se_high>Jessica: Don't jinx us with talk like that!
If the sun mirror doesn't work, we're really going to be up the creek without a paddle.

<se_def>Angelo: We've got that old man to thank for this.
Without his advice, we couldn't have restored the mirror to its former glory.
<se_def>Angelo: And it was him who showed us how to lift the Princess's curse as well, if only temporarily.
<se_low>King Trode: When we used that illuminated sea chart, a jolly strange thing happened to our map!
<se_low>King Trode: I suppose we should try following the line of light that appeared, and see where it leads us. It's all rather exciting, isn't it!?

<se_low>Yangus: Trust Captain Crow to 'ave a map like that up 'is sleeve!
Amazin', innit!?
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose we'd better follow the line to that island, an' see wot it's all about then, eh!?

<se_high>Jessica: An illuminated sea chart...
An illuminated path...
It all sounds so familiar.
<se_high>Jessica: Do you remember where we first heard about them, <hero>?
<se_def>Angelo: The island that the sea chart's pointing to is as remote as they come. There's no way into it, so it can't ever have been explored.
<se_def>Angelo: Should we really take any notice of a scrap of paper telling us to go somewhere like that!?
<se_low>King Trode: At last! Medea and I can finally be rid of this curse! We finally have a chance to recover our stunning good looks!

<se_low>King Trode: Hurry, <leader>!
If you manage to defeat the Lord of Darkness, my gratitude will know no bounds!
<se_low>King Trode: What!? You mean to say you were defeated by that nauseating hound!?
<se_low>King Trode: The humiliation! And you nonetheless felt it was acceptable to show your shame-sullied faces before Medea and myself!? It's an insult!

<se_low>King Trode: Hmph! I suppose you're hoping I shan't order you to about-turn and finish the job!?<page>King Trode: Well, I have news for you!
That's precisely what I'm doing! Now GO!

<se_low>Yangus: Y'know that funny leaf we got in Tryan Gully?
D'you reckon somefin' like that can really work?
<se_low>Yangus: I dunno meself. But if it 'elps us get to that dog, you won't 'ear me complain. Leaf, twig, branch or wotever it is.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a good idea to get yer weapons an' that in order. An' buyin' some medicinal 'erbs an' stuff's smart thinkin' an' all.<page>Yangus: Just better 'urry, that's all, guv.
<se_low>Yangus: The ugly mutt'll be droolin' over the Lord 'Igh Priest right now, gettin' ready to finish 'im off.<page>Yangus: If we don't get a move on, there won't even be no bones left!
<se_high>Jessica: I can tell that the black dog is going to be a tough customer.<page>Jessica: It'd be pretty strange if it wasn't! I mean, it's possessed by the Lord of Darkness.

<se_high>Jessica: So we'd better be fully prepared before we face it.<page>Jessica: If you aren't feeling confident, now's the time to hone your skills and make sure you're in peak condition for when we confront it again.
<se_high>Jessica: This is one battle we cannot afford to lose!
<se_high>Jessica: I'm so angry, I can't stop shaking.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't afford to let it strike again!
I won't PERMIT it to strike again!<page>Jessica: No more death and suffering!
We have to stop that damn dog!

<se_def>Angelo: We have the power to fly now, don't we?
So what are we still doing grovelling about on the ground?
<se_def>Angelo: The beast we're after is soaring about in the sky. We'd have a much better chance of finding him if we did the same.

<se_def>Angelo: To be honest, I don't get the feeling that victory awaits us... It's not fear.
I prefer to call it realism.

<se_def>Angelo: I know we've got to win.
I know that's the only acceptable outcome.
I'm just a bit...tired, that's all.
<se_low>King Trode: Rather slyly, I managed to listen in on Marcello's speech. What dreadful scheme is that man plotting!?

<se_low>King Trode: Forget about the sceptre for a moment, <leader>.<page>King Trode: As a king, I cannot allow that man to proceed with his villainous plans.
Your orders are to defeat him!

<se_low>King Trode: What!?
You mean to say he's too strong for you!?

<se_low>King Trode: But you're the only ones I can ask!
You MUST be victorious! There's no other way!

<se_low>King Trode: Fighting is your responsibility.
My role is supervisory, you understand.<page>King Trode: So kindly fulfil your duty and defeat Marcello, <leader>, whilst I continue to supervise you with customary diligence.
<se_low>King Trode: I thought you'd been away for rather a long time. I was starting to wonder what had happened to you.

<se_low>King Trode: I never imagined you'd been incarcerated on Purgatory Island!
That Marcello is a fiend indeed!

<se_low>King Trode: Well, I'm very glad to have you back.
It's quite impossible to relax without you around.
<se_high>Princess Medea: Neigh!

<se_low>King Trode: It seems the new Lord High Priest's inauguration is due to take place on the Holy Isle.<page>King Trode: He's hardly wasting any time.
There's barely a moment to catch one's breath after His Holiness's funeral.

<se_low>King Trode: ...Oh dear!
It seems you were absolutely right.
We must stop him!

<se_low>Yangus: I couldn't make sense o' none o' that stuff Marcello was on about.
Went right over me 'ead, it did.
<se_low>Yangus: But I did get somefin' from it.

<se_low>Yangus: He's a nut! An a double 'ard one at that!
Time to roll up our sleeves again, guv, an' get crackin'!

<se_low>Yangus: Don't look like Marcello's gonna 'and over the sceptre wivout a fuss.
But I ain't backin' down!

<se_low>Yangus: That was just a dry run, eh guv!?
Now it's time to get down to business!

<se_low>Yangus: Purgatory Island!?
Who does 'e think 'e is!?<page>Yangus: I've seen the inside of a few cells in me time, but YOU...!?
No one puts the guv'ner be'ind bars! NO ONE!

<se_low>Yangus: That Marcello's 'istory!
He's got a face full o' knuckle comin' 'is way!

<se_high>Jessica: That's weird. Marcello was acting like the jerk he normally is.
Nothing's changed.

<se_high>Jessica: Not that it matters now.
One thing's certain: we have to defeat Rhapthorne.

<se_high>Jessica: I don't care how many times he knocks me down, I'll just keep on getting up again!
I'll never give up! Ever!

<se_high>Jessica: <Cap><hero>!
Let's go back to the Holy Isle of Neos!
We have to defeat Rhapthorne!

<se_high>Jessica: So the last heir of the great sages is gone.
And now the world feels so...quiet.
Too quiet, if you ask me.
<se_high>Jessica: I have a horrible feeling that there's unspeakable trouble brewing right now...

<se_def>Angelo: ...One humiliating defeat is more than enough.
It won't happen again.

<se_def>Angelo: He's the enemy now.
He might've been a different person once, but now he's on a mission to conquer the world.

<se_def>Angelo: He has to be stopped.
We must defeat him, no matter the cost.
<se_def>Angelo: If we let him go now, he'll get himself established as the Lord High Priest.<page>Angelo: His guard will be so tight, we won't stand a chance of getting near him.
<se_def>Angelo: We've got one shot at defeating Marcello, and it's now. Let's go!
<se_def>Angelo: ...Come on! We haven't got long!
<se_high>Red: That mutt can shift, eh, wot wiv them massive wings on its back!

<se_high>Red: So wot's yer plan? Do some bodybuildin' an' make our legs stronger? Pull the other one!
We ain't got an 'ope of catchin' it on our pins.
<se_high>Red: We lost that cos we weren't tough enough. No two ways about it, unfortunately.
<se_high>Red: But we're on the up, eh? Gettin' tougher all the time. So it ain't gonna go that way next time, right? We're gonna teach that mutt a lesson!

<se_low>Morrie: The canine has wings on its back, si?
Allora, we must take to the flies as well, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe we come across the dog by chance when we are soaring in the blues!
<se_low>Morrie: No! How can we lose?

<se_low>Morrie: But Moro Mozzarella never says dying!
We do our preparativi and fight the beast again. Si, revenge is a sweet, and we suck hard, ay?
<se_high>Red: That Marcello didn't look like 'e was bein' controlled like wot the dog was.
<se_high>Red: I'm thinkin' maybe that's 'is true colours, eh? Yeah, 'is true, stark ravin' bonkers colours.
